intro: Ruellia fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Ruellia fimbriata is typically grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
